info.title: Device Management CP API
info.description:
# Overview `Device Management CP API` bundle provides set of Restful APIs to perform various operations on entities and consume services from 6d's DMS-CP platform. The entities should be used in context of relationship to get appropriate details |Entities|Description| |---|---| |`Subscriber`| Subscriber can have assocoated device/setting/Transaction. Subscriber related information| |`Device`| Device Info and associated to subscriber| |`Settings`| Setting associated for device and for subscriber| |`Transaction`| Transaction associated with Subscriber| |`Management`| O&M specific management objects| --- ## API Bundles `Device Management CP API` are categorsed under different set of APIs based contextual relevance. |Category|Description| |---|---| |`General`| General service API provided by platform| |`SelfCare`| SelfCare specific services| |`Outbound`| Policy and Event based trigger to external systems| |`Management`| Operation & Management APIs. Access only to admin-privileged accounts| --- ## Security The platform supports both `Basic` and `OAuth2` authentication. It is encouraged to use `OAuth2` authentication for enhanced and secure way of interacting with the platform. Additionally the authorization module allows to control access to specific resources/API that are provided by the platform. The API Consumer/Endpoint should be whitelisted and authorization vector should be defined appropriately for the client account ## Getting Started Below are the steps to get started with the `Device Management CP API`. 1. Get the account created on the platform with Client credentials 2. Get the authorization vector defined for set of APIs for the client account 3. Generate an OAuth2 token using your client key by using token API. The token returned in response should be renewed as per the policy 
{
      "access_token": "string",
      "token_type": "string",
      "expires_in": "string"
    }
*Note; Get the token API details from admin* 4. Start using the API ---

get.description: Retrieve device brands and models and other configurable details which satisfy the filter criteria. Any one of the filters is mandatory.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Optional parameter to identify a tenant based on abbreviation.

parameters.name: corelation_id
parameters.description: Unique ID to identify incoming request.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Parameter to identify source of the request.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Parameter to filter records.

corelation_id.description: Unique ID to identify a transaction

get.description: Retrieve subscriber handset history based on MSISDN.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Optional parameter to identify a tenant based on abbreviation.

parameters.name: corelation_id
parameters.description: Unique ID to identify incoming request

parameters.name: msisdn
parameters.description: Subscriber MSISDN number.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Parameter to identify source of the request.

parameters.name: isLuhn_bit
parameters.description: Optional parameter to add luhn bit in response IMEI. Default luhn bit is false, to get luhn bit set parameter value as true.

parameters.name: includeDetections
parameters.description: Optional parameter to add detections in response. Default includeDetections is false, to get detections set parameter value as true.

corelation_id.description: Unique ID to identify a transaction

post.description: Send a text SMS to a specified MSISDN.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Optional parameter to identify a tenant based on abbreviation.

parameters.name: corelation_id
parameters.description: Unique ID to identify incoming request.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Parameter to identify source of the request.

parameters.name: msisdn
parameters.description: Subscriber MSISDN number.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The SMS text to be send to the user. The length of the text is not limited. If the text is longer than 145 or 160 bytes (depending on SMSC configuration) it will be delivered in multiple SMS segments.

corelation_id.description: Unique ID to identify a transaction

parameters.name: settingId
parameters.description: should be in base64

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: should be in base64

post.description: Generates settings message.  This starts a normal DMS flow including pre and post SMS (if configured). It is normally used from an external a system such as CRM/self care portal to initiate settings towards the subscribers phone.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Optional parameter to identify a tenant based on abbreviation.

parameters.name: corelation_id
parameters.description: Unique ID to identify incoming request.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Optional parameter send settings based on service.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Parameter to identify source of the request.

parameters.name: msisdn
parameters.description: Subscriber MSISDN number.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: keyword of SMS

parameters.name: shortcode
parameters.description: Shortcode of SMS

get.description: Retrieve the transaction history for the specified MSISDN.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Optional parameter to identify a service provider

parameters.name: corelation_id
parameters.description: Unique ID to identify incoming request

parameters.name: msisdn
parameters.description: Subscriber MSISDN number.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Parameter to get records based on start Date.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Parameter to get records based on end Date.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Parameter to identify source of the request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional parameter to limit the number of records.

parameters.name: activePage
parameters.description: Optional parameter to get records based on page number.

corelation_id.description: Unique ID to identify a transaction
